b61b1ba7ade302d30300d484fa2d8007 (02:41): I have an issue with coding Kerberos support into eGroupware.
b61b1ba7ade302d30300d484fa2d8007 (02:42): Technically, PHP can't do anything with Kerberos.
b61b1ba7ade302d30300d484fa2d8007 (02:42): but there is an Apache Module, mod_auth_kerb
b61b1ba7ade302d30300d484fa2d8007 (02:42): thhat permits Kerberos to bypass HTTP authentication

b61b1ba7ade302d30300d484fa2d8007 (02:44): PHP cannot directly interact with Kerberos. It sends the Username and the fact Kerberos is in play by setting AUTH_TYPE to "Negotiate"and setting REMOTE_USER to user@Domain. It never gets a password because thats the whole point. The whole thing is automated.
b61b1ba7ade302d30300d484fa2d8007 (02:44): Follow? Or am I being choppy and confusing?
34c958399a11dcc9862da8940b71e29c (02:46): I don't know anything about Kerberos or eGroupware, sorry.
b61b1ba7ade302d30300d484fa2d8007 (02:46): Its just a PHP application./
34c958399a11dcc9862da8940b71e29c (02:52): Well, like I said I don't know anything about Kerberos or eGroupware.
